website_summaries.verdict: A great, breathable and affordable pair of waders.
pros: Nylon outer is lightweight and gives good range of motion
Cinch-top opening works great to pull them snug
Includes a belt and adjustable shoulder straps for good fit
Front pocket is big enough for a fly box
Outperforms neoprene and rubber for comfort

customer_reviews.title: Nice quality for the price
customer_reviews.text: We got these for my son to use when taking the boat out of the water in the late fall when the water is pretty cold and he would typically be freezing hooking up the boat at the ramp, cranking it in and securing it. Kept him dry but not warm unless you put on some long johns and pants to help with that. But for the price compared to some of the fancier ones out there they are fine for the limited use.
customer_reviews.author: KMD

customer_reviews.title: The 8 would have been better but I will use the extra room for thick ...
customer_reviews.text: I am 5'5", 150lbs, size 8 shoe, female. I ordered a 9 after reading reviews to go up a size. The 8 would have been better but I will use the extra room for thick socks. They are wide around the hips and chest but the waist belt and chest draw string pulls it in perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Allen

customer_reviews.title: Worth it
customer_reviews.text: Top quality waders! The material is thick and comfortable and feels very sturdy. I have taken them out a few times though and they've done great. My only complaint is that the water pressure will compress the toe of the rubber boots and squish your feet a little but you can't really avoid that unless you put steel toes in 'em. The straps are comfortable and well adjusting and I love that it has a belt strap and a cord to cinch the top opening closed. Shoe size fits great, too. Great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: ... except I have to wear thin socks to be comfortable. It would have been better if I ordered ...
customer_reviews.text: Fit very well except I have to wear thin socks to be comfortable. It would have been better if I ordered size 11.5.
customer_reviews.author: Prachuab Kwanyuen

customer_reviews.title: Great Set of Waders
customer_reviews.text: Wore these within a week for a boar hunt in the swamps n North Carolina. I am 5'9, 205, size 10.5 shoes and they fit perfectly. Walked through waist-high water without issues, did not get wet at all. They were very comfortable and I wore them for over 6 hours straight. Would highly recommend this item. Can't wait to wear them again to see if they hold up.
customer_reviews.author: Terrence Murrell Mark Jr

customer_reviews.title: Ultra lite weight while still being well made.
customer_reviews.text: Love the material on these. Super lite weight but still very well constructed. Great for layering as well.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Kuehl

customer_reviews.title: BUYER BEWARE Although this product looks good and is affordable it is NOT what it seems ...
customer_reviews.text: BUYER BEWARE Although this product looks good and is affordable it is NOT what it seems to be I receive this after waiting for months for them to be in stock I finally received mine and as you can see from the pictures I provided right out of the packaging the stitching is not correct and is loose and dangling The boots are not properly attached so I decided to try them on they fit great I decided let’s go to the water and instantly just like I thought they started leaking right away You try to contact the seller about it there is no contact information
customer_reviews.author: Carl boman

customer_reviews.title: Can't beat the quality for this price!
customer_reviews.text: These waders are surprisingly better quality than what you would expect for the money. The seams look as if they will hold up well the aggressive boot tread on the boots will provide good traction. On the front of the waders is an ample sized storage pouch as well. A lot of water brands are sized soley on boot size but the TideWe waders allow for flexibility in the sizing options, a major bonus! Overall these will be fantastic waders and will work well in the trout streams.
customer_reviews.author: sharon

customer_reviews.title: Good durable waders that don't break the bank
customer_reviews.text: These waders are durable and great for colder weather. They will alow you to bundle up underneath. The waders allow for a free range of motion for any activity. The construction of these is impressive and they should last a long time. I have a little more piece of mind with little worry of something minor creating a tear or leak. If you are looking for a pair of waders for a tough job in wet conditions, or to hunt ducks in fall or winter weather, these would be great.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Solid waders. Lightweight and comfy.
customer_reviews.text: These waders are lightweight, durable, and comfortable. The boots are a little tight on the ankles but it doesn’t really bother me. Great for spring and summer trout fishing because you won’t get too hot wading the streams all day. Great price point as well. Perfect purchase for trout anglers, bow anglers, or shore fisherman
customer_reviews.author: Mohr

customer_reviews.title: Great waders
customer_reviews.text: Really liking these waders for the price. I have had a few other sets of rubber and neoprene waders and found them to be bulky and heavy. These Tidewe waders are light and durable, which is important when traversing different environments. The design and material also makes them easier to store when you're not using them. I'm impressed by the buckles and solid seams on these waders also. I'm excited to really put these to the test, I'm sure they will pass and perform well!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Big on short people
customer_reviews.text: Ok, so these are my first pair of waders. I'm not 100% sure how they should fit, but will describe how these fit. I'm 5'3 about 135 lbs and got the M6/W8. It's a bit large on me but the shoe size (W8) fits perfect. Haven't been able to try them out yet and am hoping they are water resistant. The buckles help keep everything up and more snug which is nice. It has a front pocket which I'm sure will be good to hold flies. It comes with shoes inserts too.
customer_reviews.author: Katie

customer_reviews.title: The fit.
customer_reviews.text: For what I could tell the product seemed to be good quality. Unfortunately for me the fit was not good. The legs were tight on me and it was difficult to bend in. The tightest part for me was around my calfs. I didn't realize that my calfs were big enough to effect the fit but unfortunately they were. Boot sizing was spot on but the rest of the fit was off for me. If you have skinnier legs and not over weight then these would be an excellent pair to have for fishing. My loss I'll just have to keep looking.
customer_reviews.author: Craig Maxwell

customer_reviews.title: Great priced chest high waders
customer_reviews.text: Likes: The waders overall seem well-made. Stitching and seams are even and I didn’t find any imperfections. It comes with a belt; however, because I’m a short guy (5’5”) the built-in belt loops are at chest level on me! The rubber boots are of good thickness and have good lug soles. Dislikes: As I stated, I’m only 5’5” and my inseam is only 28” - the inseam for these size 9s is 34”! YIKES! I will use my own wader belt around my middle, leaving excess “overhang” above the belt. Would’ve been great to have a size “short-stout” for folks shorter than the 5’8” average male.
customer_reviews.author: Flipinsacto

customer_reviews.title: Its waterproof but Not functional
customer_reviews.text: bought these to go surf fishing with. it worked fine except the material made me sweat so bad I was changing socks and wiping the insides down with rages every 2 hours. Temperatures I was in ranged from 40-60 degrees. Purpose of waterproofing is defeated if you're soaked from the inside out anyway... if you're sitting in a river or stream and you're not moving much this will be fine. These suck for surf fishing though. ill spend the extra money and buy a breathable set of quality made waders.
customer_reviews.author: Jnmugno

customer_reviews.title: Sizing is a joke
customer_reviews.text: Bought a smaller size for my son. Shoe size fit fine, but he could have fit entirely inside one pant leg. Look at the size 5, that's a fairly small foot, even for a tween-age boy. Yet the inseam is nearly 3ft. My inseam is less than that. Find me a man with a size 5 shoe and a 36" inseam please... I wear a size 13 and these say the "hipline" is 55.12"... That comes up to my chest. I'm 6' 2". Don't waste your time. Either their chart is off or the product is off, but in either case they don't seem to care, and just want to sell you cheap China junk. Returned.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Terrible, cheap product.
customer_reviews.text: Seam popped open in the first 10 min of wear and boot are very thin and slippery on river rocks. Thicker socks might have helped how uncomfortable the boots are but the size ran incredibly small. I was very alarmed when I put the waders on and began crossing a waist deep river and immediately felt water rushing in. Fortunately I made it across the river safely but that was one of the worst feelings ever.
customer_reviews.author: Peaches🍑

customer_reviews.title: Fits Like a glove
customer_reviews.text: I had a pair of 40 year old waders that finally gave up the ghost. I searched for a new pair that would fit. Size 14, 6'4"250#. These fit great and were not bulky like my old pair. I live in Florida and we have had a horribly wet year so far and these have come in handy working around the yard, particularly when it involved going into the pond or wetland for yard work. The movement in the new pair was outstanding compared to the old pair and the shoe size was right on, so no slippage as I walk. They are also comfortable to walk in when you are on the dry. All around a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck Swanson III

customer_reviews.title: Leaks!
customer_reviews.text: The seam in the front pocket leaked on my first trip. Chest waders are now hip waders,any higher and I'm getting water in. Extremely uncomfortable, water pressure sucks the boots to your feet and cause pain. Spend a few more $ for neoprene, these suck!
customer_reviews.author: jay Lucas

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Only used once. so not sure of the longivity of product.
customer_reviews.author: HW

customer_reviews.title: Good waders, cheap buckles.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these about a month ago and have had two of the buckles break already. The waders work fine but with broken strap buckles I will have to replace them before I can use them again. I've only used them 3 or 4 times so this is a problem. Also, I can't find any contact info for reporting directly to the company so this is where my problem goes.
customer_reviews.author: shan

customer_reviews.title: Great waders at an amazing price
customer_reviews.text: I was worried that these wouldn’t be good because they’re so much cheaper than the competition. I’ve been using them for over a month to wade in our pond and clean it up. No leaks, love the cell phone pocket and waterproof pouch. Will be ordering another pair for my husband!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, light and maneuverable with grippy soles...
customer_reviews.text: I haven't used them yet, but I did try them on and liked the way they felt. I was actually sent and charged for two pair, so I think Amazon is going to try and straighten this out with a refund for one pair. Hopefully, that will be successful because when I feel I've been mistreated somehow and not refunded, then I'll return both pair. So, we'll see how that goes with Amazon. I can't speak to the most important thing; the waterproofing and durability. But, they are very comfortable, light and maneuverable. I'm sure their durability will be equal.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy Cotter

customer_reviews.title: Great value!
customer_reviews.text: Fit is perfect. Wear size 9.5 shoe, bought 9.5 wader. With boot socks feet are snug and boot snaps onto feet perfectly. Wading through backyard swamp to cut and clear for better views of nature. Generally only knee high water. Suspenders are wide and sturdy. Belt also wide, sturdy, and fully adjustable. Comfortable, light, easy on and off! No leaks what so ever!
customer_reviews.author: Thomas R Skinner

customer_reviews.title: Check the fit.
customer_reviews.text: These waders seem to be of good quality although I haven't had a chance to actually get to the water. The problem I have is that the leg part above the boot will not go over the calves of my legs. Everything else seems to fit ok I just can't pull legs all the way up. The boots themselves look like they would fit if the lower leg wasn't so tight. My recommendation before buying these is to check out the hip wader chart for this brand. It has more measurements than the one shown for this wader. It may help you with fit so you don't have my problem.
customer_reviews.author: C. Reed

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: I got these to go on my first fly fishing trip. I tested them with a hose and there were no leaks. Wading in the river proved this also. These were very good. They were comfortable although a bit hot in summer. I probably wore too many layers. I wish they had a better pocket, but that’s what vests are for. The pocket is not great with large phones FYI. The boot size was on the mark.
customer_reviews.author: JVII

customer_reviews.title: Bit baggy, but very functional
customer_reviews.text: I’m 5’5”, almost 5’6”, and I weigh 115-120lbs. The smallest size (M5/W7) fit me pretty good. The boot fit like a size 7 shoe or 7 1/2 shoe. I can’t speak too much to the durability of the product as I haven’t used it too much, but the seals look solid. Lots of extra room. The only reason I can see someone wanting a bigger size would be due to shoe size or because the calf of the boot is too small, but this size was perfect for me.
customer_reviews.author: Lara Whitmore

customer_reviews.title: Stop looking a buy this!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is fabulous! Had to repair our pool during freezing temperatures and only because of this are we now back to enjoying our pool. Hubby is looking forward to trying it out fishing . 😀 Super cheap compared to stores even Walmart and this is leak-proof. He could feel the freezing water, said it was a weird sensation because he stayed dry. Would highly recommend!!!
customer_reviews.author: Mrs.J.P.

customer_reviews.title: Yep, like some have said, shoddy leaky construction
customer_reviews.text: Took about 10 seconds to feel that cold leak on the back of my legs. Both seams at the boot are leaking. I DO NOT RECOMMEND
customer_reviews.author: ranald

customer_reviews.title: They’ll keep you mostly dry... for a while.
customer_reviews.text: They don’t keep you 100% dry. I uploaded a picture of one of the seams and you can see how poorly it lines up. It leaks there. Buy a big tube of aquaseal if you’re going to order these. You’re going to need it. I’d wear them fly fishing in the summer or something but don’t expect to hold up or hold all the water out. If it’s cold out, pick another pair of waders.
customer_reviews.author: Nicolas J Campbell

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: So two stories, I bought a pair for myself but the website does not give a calf measurements. I measured for everything else but if you have problems with high boots fitting your calf, these won’t either. Second my husband bought a pair and they fit him fine. He tested them out in the pool for water proofing and found no leaks. Better to test them first before a big fishing trip as other reviewers found some pairs leak.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Small fit, wide calf and a bit of overweight? these are yours waders!
customer_reviews.text: Hi, I am 5' tall, 171 pounds and wear a 4 of shoes. I was struggling to find waders that fit me. These are perfect, the boots as just right with hiking socks, and they reach up to my brest. Also they are wide enough on the chest to put your skying jacket inside for not wtting it. Highly recommended. I haven't use them yet to work on the marsh, but for now I am pleased with their purchse.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Ok waders for cheap price
customer_reviews.text: Bought these waders as a backup. Have worn them once and they were ok. I walked about a half mile in them to the river and the boots were flimsy, I could feel every rock I stepped on. In the stream they were ok but again the water pressure collapsed the boots onto my feet. They seem to be pretty well made, just light with little support. I ware an 11, bought a 12, shouldn’t have. They are true to size, if not a little big. Overall, they’re ok waders for a cheep price.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy Bredin

customer_reviews.title: Awesome waders, great fit, durable, DRY!!!
customer_reviews.text: Was skeptical at first because of the price point. I have to say that these waders are anything but cheap! They are easily some of the best, most comfortable waders I've owned! I'm 5' 8" 200lbs, wear a 9.5 size boot so I went with the size 10 and they fit great! Would definitely recommend them to anyone looking for a quality water that won't break the bank!
customer_reviews.author: Joey Willey

customer_reviews.title: You won’t be disappointed!
customer_reviews.text: These are fantastic! I’ve never had Waders but when I show them to people that have they say how much better these feel and look! They are comfortable and easy to put on and wear! The boots fit great and are not too tight around my legs which is a problem I’ve had with boots! Great price when comparing to other stores and the quality is great!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Happy with mine but...
customer_reviews.text: I'm a big guy i got sized 14 based on another review. Fit perfectly great price but I also bought my daughters another brand that was 20 bux cheaper. Essentially they were the same waders with a different name and they came with a storage bag. Granted these are slightly better made bigger strapping and belt loops . I am happy with them .
customer_reviews.author: Robert C Cantu

customer_reviews.title: Too big for small people
customer_reviews.text: These are huge on me!! I'm a lady, 5'2, 130#, size women's 7 shoes and they are huge on me. The shoe part fits perfect but 9tger wise there is way too much material. The buckel belt helps but tons of extra material in the legs and in the chest area. At least it leaves plenty of room for warm clothes underneath. If you are a small person like me you might want to try a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: Amelia

customer_reviews.title: Well built waders, but gets warm inside them quickly
customer_reviews.text: I took these out for the first time the other day and here's my take: Pros -well made, 100% waterproof - very comfortable, material allows for wide range of movements Cons -non breathable, by the end of day a layer of moisture is collected inside the waders -gets too warm after a few hours of usage -doesnt come w hangers, which I saw on other brands at same price
customer_reviews.author: ChozenOne

customer_reviews.title: LEAKS
customer_reviews.text: Bought these during the Christmas Holidays. Weather too cold so I didn't use them until late February. Great Fit- but LEAKED immediately. Felt the cold water where the boot and leg seams meet. Within 30 minutes my left "boot" was filled with water. My 30 return period already lapsed. Too bad. I liked the features and fit. SUCKS
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight
customer_reviews.text: My last pair of neoprene waders finally bit the dust after 12 years. Decided to give these a shot. Price is great, product is lightweight and does what it’s supposed too. No leaks yet, pretty sure if you walks through some thorn bushes the material would tear. My downsides would be the water pressure crushes the boot down on your foot and the boots are very thin which leads to uncomfortable bumps into rocks and trees while fishing rivers. Also a bigger pocket on the inside is needed for a small tackle box, pliers and what not. These are good for quick fishing, I wouldn’t want to be in them all day. For the price it’s a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Cummings

customer_reviews.title: Great quality for a low price
customer_reviews.text: For the price, these waders are excellent! I had no problems with leaking, and was up to almost chest height at times. The fit of the body was spot on, and I appreciated the adjustable straps and belt to make the waders more comfortable for my height, however the boots ran about a half size to a size large. The boots have a very flexible, soft sole compared to regular knee waders, so depending on preference this could be a positive or negative. The one downside was having to decide between a larger size to accommodate my waist/thigh area for better movement, or a smaller size to make the boots more fitted to my feet.
customer_reviews.author: moonic

customer_reviews.title: Amazing value at an extremely fair price!
customer_reviews.text: Can’t beat ‘em for the price! I’m 6’2” and size 11 so I got the size 11s — perfect fit. I’m really impressed with the quality and overall craftsmanship. I waded out in chilly water up to my stomach and had no issues with leakage whatsoever — these babies are very water tight. And with a base layer, sweatpants and two pairs of thick socks on underneath, I was plenty warm. Highly recommend these to anyone looking for a great pair of waders at a low price. They look really sharp, too!
customer_reviews.author: Mr. and Mrs. Ryan C

customer_reviews.title: Good value for occasional use
customer_reviews.text: Definitely get what you pay for here. If you are a casual user, these will be fine. If planning to fish extended periods, these won’t last. The soles are thinner than usual, so I’m sure they will not hold up on rocks for long. The boot run true to size, of wearing thick socks, go up a size. The pocket is great but the belt cuts right across it.
customer_reviews.author: Doug

customer_reviews.title: Good for the money
customer_reviews.text: After a weekend of use I found at the end of the day I my legs and feet were more wet than I would expect from sweating. I'm not going to say they leaked but I have my suspicions. If they did it was minimal and not an issue for June fishing but February might be a different story.
customer_reviews.author: nshopper

customer_reviews.title: Saved from Muck
customer_reviews.text: These were perfect for doing motor work on our pontoon boat. The lake bottom by our pier is muddy and yucky. This enabled my husband the ability to work on the motor in the water instead of having to haul it out and work on it. Good fit and water tight. Would buy another pair just as a backup if we need two people in the water.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra

customer_reviews.title: large boot size
customer_reviews.text: This are very light waders. They are well designed and I've worn them three times working around my dock without problems. However, the material is very light and might not stand up to rough conditions as might be encountered in hunting. I wear a 8 1/2 shoe size and bought an 8 wader. The boot size is very big and I could probably have done with a 7.
customer_reviews.author: B. Staehle

customer_reviews.title: Enjoyable gift.
customer_reviews.text: My children bought these as a gift for Father's day. My husband loves them and is able to fish in many more spots than ever before. He is greatly pleased. He found them to be comfortable, water resistant, and easy to move around. They have definitely increased his fishing pleasure. After reading reviews, we went up a size to accommodate his belly, but he found that he could still smoothly maneuver about the river.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Product!
customer_reviews.text: It is a great product! I have used it several times. It is light weight and waterproof. The quality is terrific! Getting in the water I dont feel the cold temp of the water at all. If I feel like I am going to stumble or fall I feel EXTREMELY confident that they will not rip or tear. The one thing I would suggest is that you wear long sox if you are wearing shorts underneath. The reason why I say this is because it rubs my skin right above the boot and eventually gices me a slight burn. But that is a simple fix!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Joel J Borek

customer_reviews.title: Great waders
customer_reviews.text: Very nice waders especially for the price. I'm new to waders so don't have a lot of reference, but they have worked great for me the two times I've used them. Completely waterproof and fit (size 11) well for me. Had to walk about 1000 yards over land to get to water. Not very breathable, as expected, but waterproof.
customer_reviews.author: Spike

customer_reviews.title: Great waders for the price
customer_reviews.text: They have worked out great so far. They are a little tight, I am 6'3" and 265lbs with a size 12 shoe and they are a little tight getting into them and not quite tall enough for me but they are great once on. I use them launching the boat and wading for crab in salt water in NW Washington. I don't expect to use them in the winter since they are thin material but they are much more comfortable temperature wise than neoprene in the summer here.
customer_reviews.author: Howard Cunningham

customer_reviews.title: Surprised by quality for the low cost.
customer_reviews.text: Surprised by the quality. For the price I was expecting a little less. I bought these for my wife and she has not used them yet, however they appear of a much higher quality than I assumed they would be for the price. They appear durable, however not having used them yet I gave them a four base on appearance alone. Once she uses them I may update the review. I think you may be surprised by the quality of these for the very low price.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: One of four waders leaked.
customer_reviews.text: We bought four waders, sizes 5, 6, 11 and 12, to go trout fishing last week. We wanted two in brown and two in green, but the size 5 was only available in brown, so we ended up with three brown waders and one, the size 12, in green. The three brown waders worked fine, but the green one leaked somehow. So, this coming week I will be returning the size 12 green wader and exchanging it for a brown one that, hopefully, doesn't leak.
customer_reviews.author: reticent farmer's wife

customer_reviews.title: Awesome price for great waders
customer_reviews.text: Great quality product for a great price, I’m 5’2 and 150 lbs, size 7 shoe. These for great and has adjusting straps and belt for all sizes. Completely waterproof and boots seemed to have good traction
customer_reviews.author: Jenna

customer_reviews.title: They leak after a few times of using.
customer_reviews.text: These waders seemed like an amazing purchase, until the 3rd time I wore them. I was only in the water for a few minutes before they were completely filled with water. At first water started to come in somewhere around my left foot, and then it poured in. Furthermore, as the water started rushing in the left side, it started coming in around my right foot. It wasn't like a small leak either. I had to completely remove them to make it back to shore. That also meant, I had to walk barefoot on top of not the softest terrain.
customer_reviews.author: TxCurls

customer_reviews.title: Feels Good In Water
customer_reviews.text: When I first tried these on they felt really baggy and uncomfortable but once I got into the water they were great. I went with a size up to 10. Shoe size 9 1/2, 5'10" 190lbs. Felt there was a little to much room in the foot for me but a size smaller would've been to worse I think. The part right above the boot is what annoyed me the most but like I said once I was in the water it was great. I wore shorts and a t-shirt and came out sweating in 60 degree weather.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable & good value
customer_reviews.text: Didn't want to spend a fortune on waders; these are a good fit, and have proved waterproof after standing for hours in a cranberry bog! The belted waist actually makes them stylish & flattering... as far as waders can be flattering! Love the pocket for my phone. Definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs A.

customer_reviews.title: Very small
customer_reviews.text: I cant put them on with pants, they are so tight that I dont think I could use them unless it is summer, no good for winter ducks.
customer_reviews.author: Brittney

customer_reviews.title: You might need a size bigger on the boots
customer_reviews.text: I'm 5'10" 170lbs and normally wear size 9.5-10 boots. But the size 10 on these waders were too small, leaving my toes touching the tip of the boots. I did however exchange for a size 11 and now these fit perfect with room for thick socks as well. Just my two cents
customer_reviews.author: Buzz Gordon

customer_reviews.title: Waders for a short small foot woman
customer_reviews.text: I like these, we live on a River that floods & I need to help take our floating dock in & out. I am 5'1" & wear a size 6-1/2 to 7 size shoe, so I was concerned with how big or tall they were going to be. The foot fit GREAT, & the length or height of them adjusted to me perfectly. They also have a waist belt which for a girl is really nice giving me a figure when wearing the waders. They seem pretty heavy duty too.
customer_reviews.author: SnowCat

customer_reviews.title: Ordered a size up and way too big
customer_reviews.text: We ordered 3 of these and we all ordered one size up and the boot is way too big on all of ours even with double wool socks. Walking in the mud on our duck hunt and pulls the boot right off our feet. Also with it had a cross strap to keep the shoulder straps from falling off our shoulders. Other than that they were waterproof and worked fine for the price.
customer_reviews.author: code3run

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value with fantastic customer service
customer_reviews.text: I have taken these on about 6 fishing trips thus far. Excellent quality for the price. I had an issue with small leaks after my fourth trip. I contacted customer service and they were quick to replace the waders for free. I have used the replacements now on 2 occasions and they have served me quite well. I will update again if I have any trouble with leaks with the replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: I have been using these waders for over 2 weeks on fishing trips to the river. I haven't had a problem with them leaking and they feel great even walking on the rocks. The straps do slip a bit off of my shoulders if they are too loose, so I need to add a strap that holds them together.
customer_reviews.author: Travis

customer_reviews.title: They leaked
customer_reviews.text: The price was awesome... I needed them to do some work in my koi pond before the winter... Unfortunately the left side above the boot leaked and my foot got soaking wet... by the time I had finished the project in my pond my entire left leg and boot were almost completely filled with water to the knee... again, the price was great but I guess you get what you pay for we’re not ordering more expensive waders...
customer_reviews.author: James Moore

customer_reviews.title: Shocked!
customer_reviews.text: I honestly was in a bind and couldn’t buy waders locally due to store closures with Covid. So I I ordered these, and I honestly didn’t expect much. However, I fished in a freezing cold river all day and stayed dry, fairly warm, and didn’t slip on greasy rocks! I was shocked at how good these were. They were true to size, made really well, and overall were pretty comfortable. I actually forwarded the link for these to a friend of mine and told him to get a pair. Awesome buy!
customer_reviews.author: Mdover30528

customer_reviews.title: Well made, but THEY RUN SMALL
customer_reviews.text: They seem to be well made, but be aware that the boots run small. I take a size 12 comfortably, but I had to return them for a size 13, as my toes were hitting the front of the boot.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Nolen

customer_reviews.title: Worth the buy
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my daughter's Science class (all students needed them). They fit over my daughter's clothes just right. We were concerned about the size (thought it would be too big) but they fit just right. And the boots are attached so it made it a very easy buy. I would recommend this product to all.
customer_reviews.author: The Crew

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply made waders
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for a dock building adventure. Not very comfortable with extended use. Straps were constantly falling no matter how tight they were adjusted. The boots were very uncomfortable and due to the water pressure will suck in and rub your feet raw. Bright side, they did not leak
customer_reviews.author: COMFORTABLY NUMB

customer_reviews.title: If you have a calf muscle these are too small
customer_reviews.text: These look like decently made product but even though I got a size 13 the part of the wader that connects the boot to the leg is so small that my calf will not go into them. The rest of the fit is fine after some adjusting but I can't get my leg into these waders even with no layer under them. I'm not sure why the calf section is made so small, if you don't have pencil legs these will not work for you.
customer_reviews.author: Casey

customer_reviews.title: Fine but easily rip
customer_reviews.text: My husband wore these for the first time earlier this week. While he was in the water, he noticed his leg felt wet. Sure enough, there was a small hole near the back of his hip. He couldn't remember a time when he could have ripped it (didn't feel anything). We are unsure if they came with the hole or if they are just such lightweight material that it easily ripped. He needed to use them the next day so they are currently patched with duck tape. Hopefully that holds and no other places rip.
customer_reviews.author: Hayley

customer_reviews.title: Great waders
customer_reviews.text: Love these waders. Great fit, I'm 5'3" and 138 lbs and wear size 7.5 in womens shoes. I bought the size 5 and they fit great. Don't leak at all. I think some people think they leak because you can sweat in them even in cold water.
customer_reviews.author: MG

customer_reviews.title: Leaked within first 15 minutes of use.
customer_reviews.text: Began to leak in right outer thigh area within the first 15 minutes of use. I was in the lake this weekend putting in dock ice went out two days earlier. I was excited about having a new pair of waders to keep me dry. Well the waders looked great fit great. But the most important feature of waders being waterproof. Well let's say I was was not happy being wet and cold.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Seem okay, haven't worn yet small tear by pull string.
customer_reviews.text: The loophole for the drawstring tore the very first time I pulled on it. I wasn't trying to tighten it or anything, just trying to bring plastic black knot holder down into place and it ripped. I don't see it being a problem, since I don't wade chest deep, but it is annoying that they are torn and I haven't even worn them yet.
customer_reviews.author: Chris LaRue

customer_reviews.title: Great waders!
customer_reviews.text: These are great utility waders for working in the water. Not sure if I would wear these long term in cold water as they are not insulated but they are light weight and great for putting the dock in and out at the beginning and end of the season.
customer_reviews.author: Kristie LaDuke

customer_reviews.title: Happy I purchased waders. Good investment!
customer_reviews.text: Bought three waders one for my husband, son and son -in-law. Using for high water level by river. I have been told the waders are comfortable. By looking at the waders, you can see they were made well and will last for a long time. For future customers, make sure to go by guide lines recommended from the manufacturer concerning sizing.
customer_reviews.author: Frances

customer_reviews.title: Light weight and good fit.
customer_reviews.text: As a larger individual, 6' 265 lbs. I find the neoprene waders to be to snug around the mid section. The TideWe PVC waders are not to tight. The material is light weight. Boot fit is really good. My old waders my feet slid around in the boots. Not like that in the TideWe waders. Good grip while in the water too. The straps are durable and comfortable on the shoulders. All in all these are excellent waders. The price point is spot on!! I would highly recommend these to anyone looking for a great pair of waders at a very fair price.
customer_reviews.author: Marcus Gorham

customer_reviews.title: Very decent for the price
customer_reviews.text: I don't have a lot of experience with PVC waders but this seem just "okay". They aren't the most comfortable to wear but they will keep you dry and they do seem to fit alright. The quality seems very middle of the road. No part of the construction stood out as a problem and I did not have any trouble with leaks on my first use but I am concerned about their longevity. For short term use, however, these are great.
customer_reviews.author: julienj

customer_reviews.title: Great waders for Alaskan waters!
customer_reviews.text: Took these out into the Kenai, Resurrection Bay and various lakes over the summer. Nice pair of waders, the boots are solid and fairly comfortable. The front pouch is perfect for a phone or other important items and the overall quality of the material is good. The fit is a little loose but that does allow for layering in cooler temperatures so it's not quite a minus. Would highly recommend for quality and price!
customer_reviews.author: AK V00D00

customer_reviews.title: Stop overspray from the pressure washer.
customer_reviews.text: I wear felt soled shoes with my fishing waders. I bought these to wear when I am using the pressure washer. It sprays water everywhere. I stay dry when I am wearing these. They work well. Too new to rate durability.
customer_reviews.author: Outdoorsman

customer_reviews.title: Affordable, no leaks
customer_reviews.text: Affordable, comfortable, and best of all, they did not leak during a week in the tundra photographing birds in late winter weather. At the end of the day there always seemed to be a bit of moisture inside the waders, due to body perspiration, not leaks. They don't breathe. Also, wish there were more pockets, but I guess that is impossible with chest waders.
customer_reviews.author: Customer FD

customer_reviews.title: Great fit
customer_reviews.text: I received the waders on schedule. I was afraid they would be too long, as I have a 30” inseam. But they fit great. With pair of heavy socks the boot fit great. The length gave me room to maneuver. Overall - A GREAT FIT and COMFORTABLE.
customer_reviews.author: Papa C

customer_reviews.title: Great waders!
customer_reviews.text: Just now got a chance to use these waders and they are amazing. I’m 5’8 and the size 8 fit my height barely with the straps tighten all the way. I wear a size 8 1/2 shoes and these fit perfectly. Works as advertised, waterproof. Seller was also #1 to quickly addressing any of my concerns. It does somewhat stink of rubber and hopefully goes away over time.
customer_reviews.author: watupson

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: Bought these as a gift for my dad who is getting into saltwater fishing and he loves them. They are comfortable, have an integrated belt (which is extremely important for surf fishing safety) and are good quality. They do have a strong plastic smell out of the box but after a few hours hanging in the garage, one time being used at the shore, and a quick rinse with the hose to remove the salt, the smell is gone. Great waders for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Allstar0419

customer_reviews.title: Quality for Price
customer_reviews.text: Really well made. Durable and lightweight. Almost perfect fit. Just need a little more shoe length. Returning for larger size.
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: Waders
customer_reviews.text: Returned the 1st waders I bought because of a leak on the right foot, reordered another one and spent 15 min. in the water and no leaks so I know when I put them on in the spring I will be fine using them, I also bought the hanger for them so they can stay in the right position during the winter. Thanks, Denis.
customer_reviews.author: Denis

customer_reviews.title: Not waterproof
customer_reviews.text: They were quite comfortable. But after 3rd wear they leak. I thought maybe it was sweat. Nope, there is a leak on a seam somewhere. My husband has a pair from different manufacturer, so I'm back to wearing his.
customer_reviews.author: surfer CA girl

customer_reviews.title: Great waiters for the price!
customer_reviews.text: Great waiters for the price. I have used twice already in different rivers and no leaks. The only adjustment I had to make was adding some insoles for the boots. The boots have no padding but I found a cheap pair at a sporting goods store and now it’s perfect. I’m 5’5” 160lbs with a stalky build and these waiters fit just a little baggy, this is for reference on sizing.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great wader for price range.
customer_reviews.text: Product seemed well made for price. Used on a cold day kayak excursion. Upper material was great. Boots lacked a little in comfort and tight at calfs making it hard to layer bottoms. I wear a 10.5 in work boots and the 11 had more than enough room to layer socks. All in all, happy with purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for muddy pond
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to wear while clearing our pond of lily pads and they are perfect for the job. The bottom of our pond is covered with mud/muck and these give me enough traction to do the work. I am a 5"6" woman and weigh about 145 pounds with a size 8 foot. I ordered the size 6/8 and am glad that I did *not* order a size up as some reviews recommend. I have plenty of room in the boot to wear lightweight hiking socks and would worry that the mud would create too much suction on a larger size.
customer_reviews.author: Krista

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I have used this wader at least four time now and it is very comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Sonnie

customer_reviews.title: Leaked in 1st 40 minutes
customer_reviews.text: We bought these at the beginning of camping season knowing when we pull the docs out it’s chilly. They started leaking in the first 30 minutes and was soaked at the end of the hour. Unfortunately our return window has closed before we even wore them. Not sure if we just got a bad pair or what. Have been unable to contact shop with response.
customer_reviews.author: Kristi Rose

customer_reviews.title: Good Inexpensive waders
customer_reviews.text: Well I was a bit skeptical about the price and wondered if these waders would leak the first time. I wore them fishing in the Great Smoky Mountain National Park two days straight and was up a little past the wader belt a few times and they did just fine. I was pretty rough on them and even fell a couple of times on the slick rocks. I would, and have already, recommended them to anyone looking for inexpensive waders to start fishing.
customer_reviews.author: tony mains

customer_reviews.title: These Waders worked good for me
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Waders to build & install a dock at our cabin. The lake bottom is pretty mucky where we keep our boat so bare feet wasn't an option. I bought 2 pair because we needed 2 guys in the lake. I used the sizing chart that Tidewe had on the Amazon sight and the waders fit perfectly. I stayed dry with but my brother's pair had a small leak. I retuned the 1 pair with no problem. They were happy to replace them. I think it was a fluke that the 1 pair had a leak because my pair worked real good. They seem well made and are reasonably priced.
customer_reviews.author: B. E.

customer_reviews.title: Light weight and comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: I have not put these to use yet -- I won't have a chance until spring. However, they appear well-built, are lighter than I expected, and are comfortable. I am looking forward to getting them wet!
customer_reviews.author: D. D. LeDu

customer_reviews.title: Work ok but too tight wound my calves
customer_reviews.text: Have used 4 times now. I cannot use them with jeans as they make it too tight around the calves. I ordered size 10 and the boots fit fine. I can only wear with very thin pants making this a warm water only wader. Stinks to high heaven still also.
customer_reviews.author: justsaytim

customer_reviews.title: Good feeling product, fit better than expected, but havent been in water yet
customer_reviews.text: Bought them to launch and retrieve my boat in the colder weather as I have to get wet to get the boat on and off the trailer. However, from the quality of the material and the way they fit, I am confident that I made a good purchase. I will update once I actually get them wet!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: The material not durable enough. I must have brushed up against something underwater. Had a tear in them in less than 15min. Chest high in water with a tear resulted in the waders filling up with water. Not safe!! Actually quite dangerous. Then upon removing them with quite a bit of water inside, the whole boot tore off. Cannot see how these are advertised for hunting and fishing. Maybe wading in a swimming pool would be a better use. Would not recommend or purchase again. You get what you pay for. What a disappointment!!
customer_reviews.author: PR

customer_reviews.title: Impressive!
customer_reviews.text: I was worried after reading some of the reviews for this product, but decided to order it anyways. I'm thoroughly impressed with the product. I only fished once in them, but crossed a waist-deep, fast river more than a dozen times while hunting. Not even one minor problem so far.
customer_reviews.author: Ed

customer_reviews.title: ***Keeping dry is what is all about***
customer_reviews.text: The only comment is as phones get bigger..you need to increase the size of the pouch...My Samsung phone does not come close to fitting....I was loiking forward to havi g a safe place for my phone...
customer_reviews.author: RCXcellent Adventures

customer_reviews.title: Updated review from April 2019 - Not as pleased after initial usage
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for a wading/trout fishing trip in Spring of 2019. They worked great for a 3 day period. I stored them and pulled them back out this year (within a year of first using) and after about 20 minutes came to find there was a leak coming from a separation of the boots and nylon pant leg. I know you get what you pay for, but I assumed I would have got a bit more usage (literally used 4 times in less than a year span) than what I did. Very delicate material.
customer_reviews.author: Gabe

customer_reviews.title: Good purchace
customer_reviews.text: With free standing water in the crawl space under my kitchen, these came in very handy when I had to work on my water line and drain lines. Kept me dry and really simplified the work I needed to get done. However one of the shoulder strap fasteners broke because of the type of material they are made of. Still functionable though.
customer_reviews.author: Harold P.

product_meta.title: TIDEWE Bootfoot Chest Wader, 2-Ply Nylon/PVC Waterproof Fishing & Hunting Waders with Boot Hanger for Men and Women (Green and Brown)
feature_bullets: ATTENTION: Please Match the size selection to your Normal Shoe Size. If your Feet are Wide or you need to wear Thick Socks, please Choose ONE SIZE LARGER than usual.

LIGHTWEIGHT: The waders is 35% LIGHTER than traditional rubber waders due to RUGGED nylon with two-ply upper fabric, making it easily fit into any backpack. You hardly feel tired when fighting with big fish!

100% WATERPROOF: Nylon-reinforeced PVC upper with waterproof boot attachment and taped seams guarantee 100% waterproof reliability. Water Intrusion Resistance processing helps seal out water and dirt during long days on the water.

User Friendly Design: Adjustable H-back web suspenders with durable quick release buckles, flip-out chest pocket and top draw cord, delivers convenience. We proivde boot hanger to solve your drying problem. FREE 100% water-proof phone case is included to protect your belongings.
ALL-PURPOSE: It is designed to keep you dry and warm on your fishing adventures, hunting, farming work, or any messy situation. Waders sizes range from 7 to 14 (Please refer size chart)

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
